DataElement.preferredName: Kaposi Sarcoma Related Genitalia Edema Intervention Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the type of intervention for scrotal/genital edema.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Kaposi Sarcoma Related Genitalia Edema Interventions
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to an intervention (an action intended to alter the course of a pathologic process) for Kaposi Sarcoma (a malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells) related genitalia (the external sex organs) edema (pathological transudate within one or more tissues).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin however, it may also occur internally.  It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).:Related; connected or associated.:The external sex organs.:Pathological transudate within one or more tissues.(FMA)

Concepts.definition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).
A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.
Accumulation of an excessive amount of fluid in cells or intercellular tissues.

Property.preferredDefinition: An action or ministration that produces an effect or that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An action or ministration that produces an effect or that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
